Dog abuse…..

The wonderful thing about this kind of deterrence in dogs is that once kearned, the laser rock is relatively superfluous until the behaviour starts to extinguish itself (a hot wire is even more effective, and while some may complain about mythical “humaneness”of using one - almost always once a dog has encountered it once or twice and learned what & where it just can be powered down as the dog will never go near it again. If you gave a dog which is a Houdini-type escape artist, or if neighboring more aggressive dogs are entering your yard (for example if you have an intact female in heat) then a simple hotline can be the most effective way to prevent the loss, injury or death of your pet (if it escapes). Simply leaving the uncharged wire or tape up in the same place is enough of a difference to prevent your dog from wanting to go near it again. If you see them straying towards it, you can reinforce the training by placing a temptation such as a treat which would bring them back into contact with a re-energized wire to remind them before turning it off again.

On ranches, when we wanted to train local coyote and predator populations about electric fencing, we would poke a couple of holes in a can of sardines and hang them from wires in the fence. Just like dogs, they would rapidly learn, that no matter the temptation - the electric fence line was not worth coming into contact with.
